group_1.narration: <Cleopatra VII Philopator was born@the daughter of Ptolemy XII Auretes.>
<In 51 BCE, at the age of eighteen,@she and her brother Ptolemy XIII@took the throne together in accordance@with her father's will.>
<It is said that she met Caesar@three years later.>

group_1.textRight: Gaius Julius Caesar…
He was the man who led Rome.
A man of incredible power who controlled@the entire government…
But even Caesar…
…stood no chance against@Queen Cleopatra's charms.

group_1.narration: <Cleopatra, who had been at odds with@her brother Ptolemy XIII and her sister@Arsinoe IV, was exiled from Alexandria@in 48 BCE.>

<Caesar rescued her from her plight,@first by serving as mediator in their struggle.@Once his affair with Cleopatra was underway,@however, he took arms against Ptolemy XIII,@eventually destroying him.>
<Arsinoe IV was also captured,@thus placing Cleopatra@as the head of Egypt.>
<Following that, in 47 BCE,@Cleopatra had a son with Caesar,@named Caesarion.>

group_1.textRight: Caesar went on to take the title of "dictator@perpetuo", but given the great power he held…
He was assassinated and killed.

group_1.narration: <Even so, Cleopatra chose to pledge@support for Brutus and his fellows@who led the assassination.>
<She allied with them due to their control@of East Rome, but it ended in their defeat@and annihilation in the Battle of Philippi@in October 42 BCE.>
<A certain man among the victorious@successors to Caesar ordered Cleopatra@to appear before him.>

group_1.textRight: While Antonius was initially at odds@with Queen Cleopatra,
he fell for her at first sight and became@her ally.
Antonius would go on to wed our queen.
Although he had a Roman wife,@they divorced.
Queen Cleopatra has an incredible power@to take people into her sway.

group_1.textLeft: And now she and Antonius have@three children together…
And that brings us to the present, yes?

group_1.textRight: Correct.

group_1.textLeft: …To think she alone brought down@Rome's mightiest men…
Oh, I wonder what she looks like…!

group_1.textRight: As long as you always remain faithful to the royal@family, you may very well meet her someday.
Remember, Ebony. The royal family@comes first.
Above all else, the royal family@comes first…

group_1.narration: Eventually, my dream came true,@and I was able to present myself@before the queen.
And that wasn't all.@I even got to work for the royal family…

group_1.textRight: You must be Ebony of the Met?
*Chuckle* How pure!
No need to be so formal…though that@may be too much to ask for, yes?
Well, anyway, let's not dawdle.

group_1.narration: At the time, it all felt like a blessing@from the gods…
The greatest days of my life were@about to unfold.
